name: Arenal Observatory Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in a standard room, view from the balcony only, would have preferred one of the Smithsonian rooms, but all booked. Room ok, biggish hotel room, nothing overly special.
reviews.title: Great view of the volcano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were directly above the Front Desk, but had no trouble with noise.
reviews.title: Greatest View ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The volcano is wonderfully close and we were able to see boulders bouncing down the slopes and a red glow at the summit at night.
reviews.title: The only place to stay if the lava flow is right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hike to the waterfall was enjoyable, with many birds, but I think serious walkers might run out of options pretty quickly.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were quite helpful and arranged a tour with ****** (not their favorite apparently) with only a token effort to sway us toward the competition.
reviews.title: Excellent location to watch volcano in lovely grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at AOL for 4 nights and had the rare opportunity to see a live volcano and lava for 3 out of our 4 nights there. We stayed in a Smithsonian room and had a full view 24/7. Sometimes in the middle of the night we were awakened by the rumbling and merely had to open our eyes to see the glowing embers tumbling down Arenal Volcano. Those pictures will forever be in our minds. The road to get there is bumpy and the ride into La Fortuna is about 25 minutes but we thought well worth it. Breakfast is included and it was ok. Dinner was very mediocre and we tried our best to eat elsewhere but after some really exhausting days it was just easier to not drive anywhere and eat rather yucky food. That was a minor price to pay forthe experience we had. The grounds are beautiful and we saw lots of interesting birds, monkeys, racoon-cousins (i forget their name!) If you're going to go to see the volcano this is the place to be!
reviews.title: Once in a Lifetime Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a 6:30 wake up call from Mr. Arenal. Fortunately we had left the curtains open and could see everything. There are a couple rooms on the second floor that are the best!
reviews.title: Watch the Volcano From your bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was great. Very friendly employees who were always helpful and kind. We stayed in the Smithsonian room. It is a large room that has a huge window that is set perfectly to view the volcano from bed. It was a very clean room. It is down a long gravel road, so it makes you want to eat at their lodge. The food their was good, but a little high for what you got. On another note, the view from the lodge was great. We are very close to the volcano and could also view arenal lake. Durning dinner (dark) their was a large eruption that was very beatutiful. This is one of very few places that you are able to see the active side of the volcano (atleast active side during the dates we were there) During that night we would wake up hearing the grumbling of the volcano and see some lava flows. In the moring we road some horses with a guide on the property for only 7/hr per person. This was an awesome ride. You were able to see a lot of the property and it was very adventurous. They had us going up and down steep banks and through water and mud. Their is also a waterfall on the property we hiked to and a hanging bridge, both were very nice. Their is another path that takes you to old lava flows, but was closed for our safety. Their are numberous hummingbirds on property, monkeys right outside the door, either a sloth or something in the racoon family, tucan's. and other varieties of exotic birds. We only stayed one night, but wish we would have stayed 2. If you go to aerenal you must stay here atleast one night!
reviews.title: Wish we stayed here longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without a doubt the best views of Arenal volcano, expecially from the Smithosian rooms. Had only planned to spend 2 nights here but extended it to 3 as there is so much to do around La Fortuna.
reviews.title: Fabulous views of the volcano with excellent facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes the trip up the dirt track to the lodge is a bit tedious, but not really a problem even in a standard car. The restaraunt serves an excellent steak, with cracking views of the volcano and also the lake. However avoid the house red wine = both merlot and cab sauvignon were like paint stripper.
reviews.title: Incredible view of volcano

likes.liked: — Proximity to the volcano and incredible view of Lake Arenal
likes.disliked: — Rough road getting there, but well worth the inconvenience upon arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If only the sun would've come out, even a little bit the Observattory Lodge would've been great. Unfortunately,the entire 3 days we were there it was drizzly, foggy and cool bordering on cold. Needless to say we didn't see the volcano. The grounds are beautiful and the restaurant, above average. We stayed in the Smithsonian rooms and if I had it to do over, I would've stayed in one of the lodges...preferably the one by the pool. Our room fronted a road and for 2 of the 3 days, cars, trucks and motorcycles drove by and they were pretty loud..even at 6 AM in the morning. The road leads to the owners house and there must've been a lot of activity there. Also, because the huge picture windows in the room face the road, anyone walking by can see in (the rooms are about 2-3' above street level).The patio area is separated by a low wall so you can't sit out and have any privacy. That was my main complaint. Nice hot tub and lots of birds and wildlife (no monkeys though). The deck off of the restaurant would've afforded some awesome views if only the fog had lifted. Important- take a rain jacket- we didn't and regretted it!
reviews.title: The weather will make or break your stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place, the restaurant, as others said wasnt so good. The breakfast wasnt bad, but I wouldnt do dinner again. The rooms were nice and clean. The view of the volcano at night from your bed was great... Never experienced anything like it. Had a nice balcony for nice viewing, volcano, birds, even monkeys. We went on the guided walk, we took the shorter one that was free. It was nice not too long. I actually could have gone longer, but my party didn't want to. It was neat to see all the flowers, trees and wildlife...We seen the toucans and I loved the leaf-cutter ants! One of the things I wanted to see. The check in staff were super nice, gave us lots of info and answered all our questions. We arrived at night, so the drive in was a little scary, the roads are not good. But we made it and glad we did. I would recommend if possible to arrive in daylight, but if not its okay.
reviews.title: Great hotel....view was wonderful...especially at night from your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I expected for ~$110/night that our room would be very standard, however, we were very pleasantly surprised! The room was quite large and comfortable with a partial view of the volcano. Unfortunately we were unable to see any lava at night (or really even views of the top of the volcano during the day due to cloud cover) but the experience was still amazing. We did some hikes in the area, and I would recommend doing the free guided hike in the morning. The tour guide shared several stories of La Fortuna/Arenal and pointed out several birds/lizards during our hike.
reviews.title: As Close As You Can Get!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the food was disappointing. And you really do not have much of a choice in terms of going elsewhere, since La Fortuna is about 30 minutes away (and $20 one way cab fare). I advise to stay put once you arrive!
reviews.title: We Loved This Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool and hot tub was another unexpected surprise. We really enjoyed soaking in the jacuzzi after hiking.
reviews.title: If you want to see the volcano, this is the only place to stay, but don't eat here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Overall I am very pleased with this hotel. Your not guaranteed to see the volcano and all I could see was clouds during my stay. I had a Smithsonian room with a big window that would have been perfect if I had clear visibility. On a few occasions I was able to hear what seemed like volcanic rumblings from the direction of the volcano which kind of made up for the lack of seeing it.
reviews.title: A mostly fine stay amongst the clouds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway... the grounds were great. The infinity pool is pretty cool and relaxing. The free morning walk in the forrest was a good time and the guide was very knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Volcano view and this made my trip

likes.liked: — The location..best possible view of the volcano.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge is very remote and a taxi into town is $20/each way so I just ate all my meals at the restaurant on site. Breakfast was free and was very good. The other meals were costly and was so so in taste etc.. Although desserts were pretty good. The banana split was well worth it.
reviews.title: Unique Hotel...no guarentee you'll see the volcano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the lodge lived up to what others say and it have been spectacular if I could clearly see the volcano. It was cool being away from it all up on a mountain a mile away from an active volcano...
reviews.title: Quite possibly spectacular view, if you can see it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long and rough ride to Arenal, we checked in at the Observatory Lodge. The room wasn't the most comfortable but the view was what I went there for. My first ever experience of seeing a volcano and an active one. More so from my room in Arenal. The lodge is a very pretty property and right in front of the volcano. The lodge has its own treks and tours around its property and a viewing area where you can sit and see the volcano spitting out the lava with rumblings right through the day and night. Being close to the volcano makes this property away from the town so if you need to visit then you have to call for a taxi. The reception area and restaurant also shut in the night so you got to have all your stuff organised. We also went for the zip lines booked through the hotel and it was an amazing experience. If going to Arenal then it has to be the observatory lodge.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay, but Beware..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had the time of our lives here!
reviews.title: Thrill of a Lifetime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: People, the little hairs that stand up on different parts of the body when you are scared, excited or that sixth sense is awakened will get a work out here. In fact, they'll have a party.
reviews.title: La Casona - A wonderful, cheaper alternative in AOL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were very lucky to see cone of the volcano both upon arrival and late at night, spewing a natural fireworks show. This place is unbelievable and totally worth the long hard ride down the pot holed ridden road (not that bad if you have some blood in your veins).
reviews.title: You can't get closer to the volcano than this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pretty basic and very clean. This is a well run place. We had to switch rooms because the full on volcano viewing room was only available one night. That is the room we woke up at 2am to see the volcano clear and spewing. The rooms switch was made easy for us by the staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful view, beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time at the restaurant gawking at the volcano drinking, noshing and yakking it up; the birds, the lake, the amazing view. The food isn't as bad as the reviews say and the drinks are incredibly cheap. Our child loved the food here. There have chess, checkers and a little TV if you are desperate for that kind of thing.
reviews.title: very close to Arenal Volcano
Needs a facelift.. But great location
reviews.text: I didn't have a ton of expectations coming to the Arenal Observatory Lodge - we were there to see the volcano (which made its ONE appearance the day we arrived and never again - nor did we hear or see any sign of eruptions!), not to hang out in our room. And good thing, too, because the room was pretty bare bones. We did have a great view of the volcano and surrounding gardens (we chose one of the Smithsonian rooms) and a very nice balcony, but the room itself was old and tired with frayed linens and quite a lot of bugs (also part of the Costa Rica experience, but when I found ants in my purse I was a little annoyed). The staff was perfectly helpful, the grounds were gorgeous (including the pool), and the food was fine (not gourmet, but perfectly acceptable). I'm not sure I'd recommend it to anyone looking for romance, but if you're there to hike around the volcano, see some beautiful gardens, look for animals and birds then this is ideal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here with our three small children for one night only because that was all we could book. Wish I could have stayed for 3 or 4 day,s though.
reviews.title: Nice, rustic lodge in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The access road is well worth it and should be fine in a high clearance vehicle. The dirt road is reinforced with concrete strips on the tight, steep turns. Once you arrive you will probably be surprised at how well manicured and extensive the grounds are. You could probably spend a couple of days wandering around the trails right on the property.
reviews.title: a frog amongst princes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very basic with no phone or TV, but our Smithsonian was clean and modern. Also, I don't think there was any kind of WiFi there. These rooms are a little away from the main area of the hotel and have a spectacular view, when it is not cloudy.
reviews.title: Nice room with terrace for a rainy day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The included breakfast buffet was very good and had lots of variety. We didn't get a chance to eat another meal there. The pool area looked incredible - too bad we didn't have time to swim.
reviews.title: Must if in Arenal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After leaving our amazingly simple and pleasant stay at Arenal Green, we headed down the horrible bumpy road to Arenal Observatory Lodge. We were stunned by how close the volcano was! The deck views of the volcano and the lake were breathtaking but where were all the chairs? ---A giant deck with about 6 chairs... not sure what that was all about?
reviews.title: Just a view. Visit for a day-no need to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was clean but we booked a standard room with a "lake view" thinking we'd be somewhat close to the main lodge. If you don't have a car, good luck making the hike up the steep hill to the lodge for any volcano viewing. Make sure you ask where your room is located because some of the standard rooms are pretty far away. Luckily, we had a car so we could drive up and down the hill.
reviews.title: Great location for volcano, hikes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food, as most know, is boring and plain. The prices are ridiculous and comparable to prices at an average restaurant in downtown Boston. We had the "chicken with onion and pepper" and the "grilled chicken"--- BLAH.
reviews.title: Peaceful with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds were nice and theres a nice trail to a waterfall but save your money, stay closer to town and visit this place for a day. You can see the lava from the road leading up to the lodge.... No guarantee you'll see anything so don't just stay here for the lava.
reviews.title: Nice Place--don't count on staff or weather, but otherwise good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this place to folks who like a comfy spot in a forest setting, and since it's a 20-minute trip down a dirt road, don't mind being off the beaten path.
reviews.title: Come for the volcano view and the fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Warning: this is located 10km on a very bumpy, gravel, pot-holed 'road'. quite difficult to get in and out of once you are at the hotel. i would strongly advise to stock up on any groceries in town, about 45 mins away, BEFORE checking in!! (water, wine, snacks). The breakfast at restaurant is pretty ok. the prices are high (for what you get) for lunch and dinner. the grounds, trails, walkways, are AMAZING!!! just STUNNING! pool and hot tub were same temp of about 75 degress = Brrrrrrrrr. nice hike to waterfalls. try to get a jr. suite, or smithsonian room for only a bit more, but TOTALLY worth it!!! i would luv to go back !!
reviews.title: absolutly, positively a MUST to stay here for BEST view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: tried to get down the very bumpy, pot-holed gravel road of about 10km long to see lava at nite, each time could never make it before 4:00 when national park gates close. finally decided just to stay at the closest resort to the volcano - best choice bay far!!! our room had a huge patio which over looked the volcano perfectly!!! was amazing to hear and see the lava rocks roll down the slope about once per hour. was an awesome experience.
reviews.title: definaltely a must to stay at arenal observatory lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was a little nervous about staying here since it is in the middle of nowhere. Ended up having a great time. Room was comfortable, staff was very nice, and the food was better than I expected. The biggest part of your trip will be how much you can see the volcano, which is mostly luck. We also went on the optional hike with Christian who is the best guide we have ever had. He was helpful, friendly and really loves his job, which shows.
reviews.title: Only place to stay for Arenal View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Observatory Lodge for two nights during a trip to Costa Rica in October 2008. We arrived at the lodge before our room was ready, and the staff allowed us to get cleaned up in a different room (we had spent the previous night sleeping in our car covered in mud after the road to Monteverde was washed out). We explored the property while we waited. The grounds are gorgeous. There are trails to hike. The waterfall trail is a must (go on your own or take the free nature walk -- the guides are great), but avoid the "Old Lava Trail" (it is treacherous when it's muddy and leads to nothing). There are two hanging bridges on the property. The volcano can also be viewed from the pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: Unbelievable views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in La Casona. Most of the guests there were in their 20s. Our room was small but very clean. The view was spectacular -- we could lay in bed and watch the lava at night. The shared bathrooms were never an issue. There are two locking bathrooms with toilet and shower. However, the three sinks are not private.
reviews.title: Untouched beauty

description: The Arenal Volcano Observatory sits in a private nature reserve in the heart of one of Costa Rica’s numerous natural areas. Rich volcanic soil supports primary and secondary rainforest. Waterfalls and crystalline rivers offer sparkling jungle refreshment for the soul. A well-marked, manicured trail system provides easy access to the property’s breathtaking natural beauty.
